column4: Every so often, usually when something tries to play a sound, the sound icon disappears from my upper bar, then reappears at full volume - even if sound was previously muted. If I'm trying to prevent popup windows from making "bonk" noises when I'm in class this is extremely inconvenient and irritating. Can someone help me figure out why this is happening and stop it?
can you make it happen right now, if you wanted to? hard to debug intermittent problems :\

Sorry, I didn't notice that you'd answered, another window took my attention. For the most part I can get it to happen pretty reliably. It usually happens whenever I don't have anything using sound, and then I type, say, backspace in KildClient, which gives me a can't-do-this beep. It also happens often when I start playing a youtube video.
no worries. my advice would be to open a terminal window and $ tail -f /var/log/messages, then try and reproduce the problem and see if anything's logging a crash
tail -f /var/log/messages gave me No such file or directory.
blerg, I always get confused with all the distros log file idiosyncrasies
Okay, I'll try to get it to happen now.
K. you're looking for anything that has to do with sound, gstreamer, segmentation faults, backtraces, lib<anything>.so, ... basically, any sort of hint as to where to go next
I'm trying to get it to happen. Isn't it typical that when you actually want it to, it doesn't?
(though i'm sure it predates me by hundreds of years :) )
Thanks :) So I can't get it to do it again. Grumblegrumble. I bet it'll wait to do it again when I'm in class.
no problem. one thing you can do is, next time it happens, just write down the exact time it happens, and come back here armed with that. Then I or someone else can help you look through your logs
